content.description:
This is an easy, warm-up traverse on the backside of the Easy Flake Boulder. This sequency boulder problem is good for practicing footwork. The name comes from the inscription carved into the rock face.

Start on the right side on good holds and traverse left. Staying low instead of following the weak layer upwards is more difficult. The topout is easy. It is good for beginners.
content.location: It is on the west side of the Easy Flake Boulder.

content.description: Stand start with your hands on good, slopey jugs, and work your left hand up to shelf and your right hand to the flake. Work both hands up to a large flake and then to slots in the overhang. Move your hands up to pocket/slots above and then to a high shelf. Work your feet up onto the overhanging face, and finish with an easy topout.
content.protection: Pads. There is a large rock in the landing area.
content.location: It is on an easy block, ascending through an easy flake.

content.description:
Sit start on first ledge of

Easy Flake

. Make one move right on rail. Gain the two pocket "taint" and a small crimp high. Pull hard for small slopers up left. Finish on small edgy plates up right and top out!!!
content.location: As you enter the parking area, this is the large boulder straight ahead of you, ~ 20' from the parking area.

content.description:
Start with big jug holds underneath the bulge (this starts on the bulge near the start of the

Yo-Tan-Chi-La Traverse

). Move out from under the bulge to a good right hand, sloping ledge. Make a move to a crimp, and the bump up the right hand above that.

Top out.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. It has a good landing.
content.location: This is on the first main boulder as you walk into Dynamite Shacks. It also houses Easy Flake. I believe this starts on the west corner of the boulder.

content.description:
The first half of this problem is great. The higher you get, the nastier the rock gets. You may want to do the good moves, hop down, and not top out.

Start at a large jug at a sit start with your right hand in a pocket. Heel hook off to your left, and lunge for the sloping arete. Compress and hit the small crimp. Dive deep with the left hand to a dish, and trend right on the sloping rail. There is a huge eye socket pocket that is either the end of the route, or the beginning of a sandy topout for you.
content.location:
It is almost the same sit start as

Low Hanging Fruit

on the Large boulder with the juggy traverse.

content.description:
This problem basically uses the foot holds of the large, overhung, warm-up traverse.

Sit start as low and far left as you can off of the big jugs. As you gain height, trend right onto the small crimps with several crosses and heel hooks. Make slap to a small dish, then head straight up towards bigger holds. Either traverse right and off, or continue straight up for a high variation that is easy.
content.location: This is on the main largest boulder near where the start of the juggy, overhung traverse is.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the small ledge, move up and right to the easy flake.  Keep traversing right and round the corner.  At this point either top out and walk off or traverse right back down to the end of the boulder and drop off.
content.location: As you enter the parking area, this is the large boulder straight ahead of you, ~ 20' from the parking area.
